comments.content: I think that int can't be null because it is primitive. But Integer is an object.
DoubleSupplier returns primitive double instead of Object Double, so since Integer can be cast to double, code will compile.

true:false. Tested
Since it is not implementing equals, it inherits the Object's equals method, which is just == tested
D is the answer

Selected Answer: D
D is true. Class doesnt implement equals so equals compares if references are pointing to the same object which is case for p1 and p2, but not p3. P3 is different object in memory (although it contains same value for pname)
